sen.j: 将軍家（しょうぐんけ）とは、日本の中世において、征夷大将軍または近衛大将に叙任された武家の棟梁が、政権を樹立する際に公家の家政制度に倣って創始したものである。
sen.e: The shogun family was the houshold system that the head of samurai, who was designated for seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") or for the head of palace guards, generated, in the medieval times, imitating the houshold system of kuge (the court noble) when establishing his government.

The shogun family was a houshold system where the head of samurai, who was designated as seii taishogun (literally: "great general who subdues the barbarians") or for the head of palace guards, generated, in the medieval times, imitating the houshold system of kuge (the court noble) when establishing his government.

The shogun family was a houshold system where the head of samurai, who was designated as seii taishogun (literally: "great general who subdues the barbarians") or for the head of palace guards, generated, in the medieval times in Japan, imitating the houshold system of kuge (the court noble) when establishing his government.

sen.j: 自身及び、世襲を確立した際には嫡子を始めとする家族と、家政機関である政所を含んだ。
sen.e: In addition to the shogun himself, it included the heir and other family members, after a hereditary system was established, and mandokoro, its household organization.
In addition to the shogun himself, it included the heir and other family members, after a hereditary system was established, and mandokoro, its household organization.
In addition to the shogun himself, it included the heir and other family members, after a hereditary system was established, and mandokoro, its household organization.

sen.j: 最初にこの概念が導入されたのは、源頼朝が右近衛大将に叙任されたことにより、従来自身の主従関係をこれに当てはめたものである。
sen.e: It was at the following timing that this concept was introduced first: When MINAMOTO no Yoritomo was designated for the head of the right division of palace guards, he applied this concept to his own master-servant relationships.
This concept was first introduced when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo was designated as the head of the right division of palace guards, he applied this concept to his own master-servant relationships.

This concept was first introduced when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo was designated as Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and he applied this concept to his own master-servant relationships.
sen.cmt: 右近衛大将を定訳に変更カンマの後にandを追記しました。

sen.j: 彼とその家臣団である御家人が朝廷からの自治の確立のために称された。
sen.e: This term was used for Yoritomo and gokenin (his vassals), to establish control of the nation by themselves independent of the imperil court.
This term was used for Yoritomo and gokenin (his vassals), to establish control of the nation by themselves independent of the imperial court.
This term was used for Yoritomo and his vassals, gokenin to establish control of the nation by themselves independent of the imperial court.
sen.cmt: 御家人の表現を変えました。

sen.j: 後に、頼朝自身が征夷大将軍に就任し、彼の子である源頼家・源実朝が就任したことで、征夷大将軍の世襲がおこなわれるようになった。
sen.e: Later, Yoritomo himself was designated for seii taishogun, followed by his sons, MINAMOTO no Yoriie and MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, establishing the system of making the post of seii taishogun hereditary.
Later, Yoritomo himself was designated for seii taishogun, followed by his sons, MINAMOTO no Yoriie and MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, establishing the system of making the post of seii taishogun hereditary.

Later, Yoritomo himself was designated for seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians"), followed by his sons, MINAMOTO no Yoriie and MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, establishing the system of making the post of seii taishogun hereditary.
sen.cmt: (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") を挿入しました。

sen.j: そして、頼朝の職名である「征夷大将軍家」・「前右大将家」の略である「将軍家」の称が確立される。
sen.e: Then the term of "shogun family," which is an abbreviation of "the seii taishogun family" and of "the former udaisho (the head of the right division) family,"both Yoritomo's position names, was established.
Then the term "shogun family," an abbreviation of "the seii taishogun family" and of the former "udaisho" (the head of the right division) family, both Yoritomo's position names, were established.
Then the term 'shogun family,' an abbreviation of the 'seii taishogun family' and of the former 'udaisho' (the head of the right division) family, both Yoritomo's position names, was established.
sen.cmt: were → was に戻しました。" → '

sen.j: また、源実朝が征夷大将軍兼帯で右大臣に就任したことにより、征夷大将軍が大臣に就任することが可能となった。
sen.e: Since MINAMOTO no Sanetomo in the post of seii taishogun also assumed the post of udaijin (minister of the right), it became possible for the person in the post of sii taishogun to assume a daijin (minister) post.

Since MINAMOTO no Sanetomo in the post of seii taishogun also assumed the post of udaijin (minister of the right), it became possible for the person in the post of sii taishogun to assume a daijin (minister) post.

Since MINAMOTO no Sanetomo in the post of seii taishogun also assumed the post of udaijin (minister of the right), it became possible for the person in the post of seii taishogun to assume a daijin (minister) post.

sen.j: だが、鎌倉時代においては、摂家将軍・宮将軍は将軍解任後も大臣に就任しなかった。
sen.e: However, in the Kamakura period, shogun from the sekkanke (the fimilies entitled to assume the post of sesshu or kanpaku) and shogun from the imperial court did not take the post of ministry even after he was relased of the shogun post.

However, during the Kamakura period, the shogun from the sekkanke (the fimilies entitled to assume the post of sesshu or kanpaku) and shogun from the imperial court did not take the post of ministry even after he was released from the shogun post.

However, during the Kamakura period, the shogun from Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents) and shogun from the imperial court did not take the post of ministry even after he was released from the shogun post.

sen.j: 再び大臣に就任したのは、室町時代に入り足利義満の内大臣就任からである。
sen.e: It was Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA in the Muromachi period, who took the post of naidaijin (Inner minister), that shogun assumed the post of a ministry again.
It was Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA during the Muromachi period, who took the post of naidaijin (Inner minister), when shogun assumed the post of a ministry again.
It was Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA during the Muromachi period, who took the post of naidaijin (Inner minister), when shogun assumed the post of a ministry again.

sen.j: 室町時代には、征夷大将軍に対しては将軍家という言い方より公方（くぼう）と言う言い方が用いられる。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, the term of kubo instead of shogunke (shogun family) was used for seii taishogun.
During the Muromachi period, the term kubo instead of shogunke (shogun family) was used for seii taishogun.
During the Muromachi period, the term kubo instead of shogunke (shogun family) was used for seii taishogun.

sen.j: 江戸時代には徳川御三家・御三卿や将軍庶子に対する将軍の嫡子に対して用いられた。
sen.e: In the Edo period, the term was used for the three special Tokugawa families, for three kyo (the name of a govermental post) families, and for the heir of shogun against a child from a legally unwedded wife of shogun.

In the Edo period, the term was used for the three special Tokugawa families, for three kyo (the name of a govermental post) families, and for the heir of shogun against a child from a legally unwedded wife of shogun.

In the Edo period, the term was used for Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family), for Gosankyo (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family), and for the heir of shogun against a child from a legally unwedded wife of shogun.
sen.cmt: 徳川御三家を定訳に変更御三卿の訳変更

sen.j: 将軍家は武家政権の時代を通じて日本の統治者の一族としての役割を担った。
sen.e: The shogun family played the role of the clan governing Japan throughout the samrai-based government era.
The shogun family played the role of the clan governing Japan throughout the samurai-based government era.
The shogun family played the role of the clan governing Japan throughout the samurai-based government era.

sen.j: 勅令により任命されたが、武家政権の確立期には天皇家を凌ぐ威勢を誇った。
sen.e: Although designated by Emperor, it boasted the power exceeding that of the imperial family in the era when the samrai-based government was first established.
Although designated by the Emperor, it boasted the power exceeding that of the imperial family in the era when the samurai-based government was first established.
Although designated by the Emperor, it boasted the power exceeding that of the imperial family in the era when the samurai-based government was first established.

sen.j: 形式上は朝廷の臣下であったが、実際には諸外国からも王家としての待遇を受けるのが通例であった。
sen.e: Although the shogun family was formally placed under the imperial court, it was customary that the shogun family was accepted as a king family by foreign countries.
Although the shogun family was formally placed under the imperial court, it was customary that the shogun family was accepted as a king family by foreign countries.
Although the shogun family was formally placed under the imperial court, it was customary that the shogun family was accepted as a royal family by foreign countries.
